articles.title: From punch cards to prompts: a history of how software got better
articles.content: Ryan welcomes Darko Mesaroš, Principal Developer Advocate at AWS and all-around computer history buff, to chat about the history of software development improvements and how they made developers made more productive.
articles.author: Ryan Donovan

articles.title: Moving the public Stack Overflow sites to the cloud: Part 1
articles.content: Stack Overflow, born on the bare metal racks of a data center, ascends to the cloud.
articles.author: Wouter de Kort, Joseph Schwanz

articles.title: Open-source is for the people, by the people
articles.content: Travis Oliphant, creator of NumPy and SciPy, joins Ryan to explore the development of Python as a data science tool, the evolution of these foundational libraries, and the importance of community and collaboration in open-source projects, including Travis’ current work to support sustainable open-source through the OpenTeams Incubator.
articles.author: Phoebe Sajor

articles.title: Building AI for consumer applications isn’t all fun and games
articles.content: Kylan Gibbs, CEO of Inworld, joins the show to discuss the technical challenges of creating interactive AI for virtual worlds and games, the significance of user experience, and the importance of accessibility and cost-efficiency in deploying AI models.
articles.author: Phoebe Sajor

articles.title: Kickstart your career by building your Stack Overflow presence
articles.content: Why lurk when you can build your portfolio and your personal brand by participating on Stack Overflow?
articles.author: Kate Smith

articles.title: Introducing your newest study buddy: stackoverflow.ai
articles.content: This AI tool can help you get answers instantly, learn along the way, and provide a path into the Stack Overflow community.
articles.author: Caroline Thomas

articles.title: Stack Overflow is helping you learn to code with new resources
articles.content: See what we’ve been doing to make Stack Overflow even more helpful for students this year.
articles.author: Zach Rutta

articles.title: Getting started on Stack Overflow: a step-by-step guide for students
articles.content: Learn how to ask questions, find answers, grow as a coder, and everything in between.
articles.author: Zach Rutta

articles.title: Back to school? Developers at Stack Overflow have some advice for you
articles.content: Whether it's battling imposter syndrome, getting over coding roadblocks, or trying to build a community at school, the Stack Overflow developers have been there and done that.
articles.author: Zach Rutta

articles.title: Kotlin is more than just the Android house language
articles.content: Ryan welcomes Jeffrey van Gogh, Director of Engineering, Android Developer Experience, at Google and board member of the Kotlin Foundation. They discuss the evolution of the Kotlin language from JVM to multiplatform, how their governance board works with the community to stop breaking changes, and the intricacies of Kotlin’s multiplatform capabilities beyond just Android.
articles.author: Phoebe Sajor

articles.title: Rediscovering joy in learning: Jason Lengstorf on the state of development
articles.content:
We sit down with Jason Lengstorf on the GitHub Podcast, where he shares his perspective on education, AI, open source, and more.

The post Rediscovering joy in learning: Jason Lengstorf on the state of development appeared first on The GitHub Blog.
